alert.note: Alert for Bradford; Coastal St. Johns; Eastern Alachua; Eastern Clay; Eastern Marion; Eastern Putnam; Inland Flagler; Inland St. Johns; Western Clay; Western Putnam (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 2:46PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of west central Flagler, southeastern Bradford, southeastern Alachua, southwestern St. Johns, northeastern Marion, Putnam and Clay Counties through 330 PM EDT... At 245 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Camp Blanding to near Newnans Lake. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, half inch hail, and minor flooding due to heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible. Locations impacted include... Palatka, Green Cove Springs, Starke, Crescent City, Interlachen, Keystone Heights, Pomona Park, Hastings, East Palatka and Salt Springs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Bradford; Coastal St. Johns; Eastern Alachua; Eastern Clay; Eastern Marion; Eastern Putnam; Inland Flagler; Inland St. Johns; Western Clay; Western Putnam
